subSubSection.paragraph:
Type ,
1 adult
female, Canada , New Brunswick, Grand Falls, in water of a small beaver pond,
20 April 1956
, by H. Habeeb ( 420 x335, 5– 56 ).

Adult female. Idiosomal shield uniformly ornamented with pits; idiosomal setae clavate and apically barbed; ratios vi : vi–vi = 2.2 , ve : ve–sci = 0.7 , sci : sce = 1.3 , c

; tarsi IV each with a solenidion ().

Gnathosoma
. Lost in the type material.

Idiosoma . Nearly round, 403 long, 339 wide. Idiosomal shield uniformly ornamented with pits surrounded with polygonal walls. Dorsal idiosomal setae clavate and apically barbed; ratios vi : vi–vi = 2.2 , ve : ve–sci = 0.7 , sci : sce = 1.3 , c

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7.
Eustigmaeus frigida (Habeeb)
(adult female). A, dorsal view of idiosoma; B, dorsal idiosomal setae.

FIGURE 8.
Eustigmaeus frigida
(Habeeb)
(adult female). A, ventral view of idiosoma; B, suranal and genito­anal area; C, coxae II–III and humeral shield.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Legs . Length: leg I 231 , leg II 181 , leg III 189 , leg IV 224 . Dorsalmost setae on femora I ( dFI ) clavate and apically barbed, 33 long, 0.6 times length of h
1
. Dorsalmost setae on genua I ( dGI ) as dFI , 46 long; on genua I peg­like, about 1 / 5 length of dGI , 9 ; on genua II peg­like, pointed, 7 . Counts of setae and solenidia on legs I–IV: coxae 2 + 1 elcp , 2, 2, 2 ; trochanters 1, 1, 2, 1; femora 6, 5, 3, 2; genua 3 + 1, 3 + 1, 1, 1 ; tibiae 5 + 1 + 1 p, 5 + 1 p, 5 + 1 p, 5 + 1 p; tarsi 13 + 1, 9 + 1 ,,. Lengths of solenidia:
I 25
, II
13 , III 6
,
IV 4 .

Gerson ( 1972 )
did an excellent redescription of all stages of this species based on materials collected in southern Quebec. The description here agrees well with Gersons redescription except that the humeral shields of Habeebs specimen are triangular instead of nearly round.
